gurmukhi: bolq dwdr mor sGn iJ`lI iJMkwrq ]dyKq diRgn pRBwv Aimq mun mn biRq hwrq ]
transliteration: Dolat Daadar Mor Saghan Jhillijhinkaarat|| Dekhat Drigad Prabhaav Amit Mounndman Brit Haarat||
translation: The voices of frogs and peacocks and the jingling sounds of arbour will be heard; seeing the influence of the intoxicated eyes of the lustful women, the sages also fall from their vows and feel defeated in their mind;

gurmukhi: ieh ibiD gulws md nj dUsr jidn ctk dY stk hY ]ibnu iek ibbyk sunho niRpq Aaur dUsr ko htk hY ]173]
transliteration: Eh Bidh(i) Hulaas Mad Naj Doosar Jading Chatak Kai Satak Hai|| Bin(u) Ik Bibek Sounoh Nripat Aur Doosar So Hatak Hai||173||
translation: The day on which such a joyful atmosphere will present itself with full brilliance, then, O king ! tell me, on that day, who will reject its impact Vivek?173.

gurmukhi: qiRqIAw puqR AnMd jidn SsqRn kh Dir hY ]kir hY icqR bicqR su rx surnr muin fir hY ]
transliteration: Triteeaa Poutra Anand Jading Shastran Kah Dhar(i) Hai|| Kar(i) Hai Chitra Bachitra Su Ran Surnar Mounndi) Dar(i) Hai||
translation: When in the likeness of Anand (bliss), he will hold the weapons and fight in a queer way, then the sages will be frightened;

gurmukhi: ko Bt Dir hY DIrj idn swmuih vh AY hY ]sB ko qyj pRqwp iCnk BIqr hr lYhY ]
transliteration: Ko Bhat Dhar(i) Hai Dheeraj Din Saamuh(i) Vah Di Hai|| Sabh Ko Tej Prataap Chhinak Bheetar Har Lai Hai||
translation: Who is there such a warriors, who will keep patience and confront him? He will abduct the glory of all in an instant;

gurmukhi: ieh ibiD AnMd duDrK Bt jidn SsqR ghim`k hY ]ibn iek DIrj suin ry niRpq su Aaur n dUsir it`k hY ]174]
transliteration: Eh Bidh(i) Anand Dudharakh Bhat Jading Shastra Gadmikk Hai|| Bin Ik Dheeraj Soun(i) Re Nripat Su Aur Na Doosar(i) Tikk Hai||174||
translation: In this way, the day on which this tyrannical warriors will come to fight holding his weapons, on that day, O king ! none else will stay there except the one with endurance.174.

gurmukhi: rqn jtq rQ suBq Kicq brjn mukqw Pl ]hIr cIr AwBrx Dry swrQI mhwbl ]
transliteration: Ratan Jatat Rath Soubhat Khachit Barjan Mouktaa Phal|| Heer Cheer Aabharan Ddare Saarathimahaabal||
translation: Studded with gems and full of pearls, the chariot will carry this mighty charioteer wearing embellished garments;

gurmukhi: knk dyK kurrwq kTn kwmn biRqhwrq ]qn ptMbr jrksI prm BUKn qn Dwrq ]
transliteration: Kanak Dekh Kuraraat Kathan Kaamanndbrit- Haarat|| Tan Patanbar Jarkasiparam Bhookhan Tan Dhaarat||
translation: Seeing the gold, the hardest of beautiful lustful damsels will be allured, forsaking their vows and he will wear ornaments and pretty garments on his body;

gurmukhi: ieh Cb AnMd mdnj niRpq jidn grj dl gwih hY ]ibn iek DIrj suin ry niRpq su Aaur smuh ko jwih hY ]175]
transliteration: Eh Chhab Anand Madnaj Nripat Jadin Gadaj Dal Gadh(i) Hai|| Bin Ik Dheeraj Soun(i) Re Nripat Su Aur Samuh Ko Jaah(i) Hai||175||
translation: O king ! the joy-giver god of love, when he will come in front, thundering in such a handsome pose, then who will confront him except the one with endurance.175.

gurmukhi: DUmR brx swrQI DUmR bwjIrQ Cwjq ]DUmR brx AwBrx inrK sur nr mun lwjq ]
transliteration: Dhoomra Baran Saarthidhoomra Baajeeath Chhaadat|| Dhoomra Baran Aabharan Nirakh Sur Nar Mu Laajat||
translation: All the gods, men and sages, will feel shy on seeing the black coloured charioteer, black chariot and horses and glorious black garments;

gurmukhi: DUmR nYn DUmro gwq DUmr iqh BUKn ]DUmR bdn qy bmq srb SqRU kul dUKn ]
transliteration: Dhoomra Nain Dhoomro Gadt Dhoomar Tih Bhookhan|| Dhoomra Badan Te Bamat Sarab Shatroo Kul Dookhan||
translation: The black eyes and black ornaments will glisten on his black body and his enemies will be in agony;

gurmukhi: As Brm mdn cqurQ suvn jidn ros kir Dwie hY ]dl lUt kUt qumro niRpq su srb iCnk mih jwie hY ]176]
transliteration: As Bharam Madan Chaturath Suvan Jadin Ros Kar(i) Dhaae Hai|| Dal Loot Koot Toumor Nripat Su Sarab Vhhinak Maih Jaae Hai||176||
translation: The day, on which this fourth son of the god of love, will move towards you in anger, then, O king ! he will move towards you in anger, then, O king ! he will loot and cut down your army in an instant.176.
